title: 2018 Tournament of Nations
text:
The 2018 Tournament of Nations was the second <a href="Tournament%20of%20Nations">Tournament of Nations</a>, an international women's <a href="association%20football">football</a> tournament, consisting of a series of <a href="exhibition%20game">friendly games</a>. It was held in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>, from July 26 to August 2, 2018, and featured the same four teams as the previous tournament.
Format.
The tournament featured the national teams of <a href="Australia%20women%27s%20national%20soccer%20team">Australia</a>, <a href="Brazil%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Brazil</a>, <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Japan</a>, and the hosts, the <a href="United%20States%20women%27s%20national%20soccer%20team">United States</a>, competing in a round-robin format, with each team playing every other once. Three points were awarded for a win, one for a draw, and none for a loss.
Venues.
Three cities served as the venues for the tournament. 
Standings.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
All times are local (<a href="Central%20Time%20Zone">CDT</a> in Kansas City and Bridgeview, <a href="Eastern%20Time%20Zone">EDT</a> in East Hartford).
Television coverage.
All three USA games were televised domestically on <a href="Fox%20Sports%201">FS1</a>.
In Australia, all three games featuring the national team were televised live on <a href="Fox%20Sports%20%28Australia%29">Fox Sports</a>.
In Brazil, all three games featuring the national team were televised live on <a href="SporTV">SporTV</a> and online at the <a href="Brazilian%20Football%20Confederation">CBF</a> website.
